name: Child deaths – United Nations Population Division (2015)
title: Child deaths – United Nations Population Division (2015)
description:
– The original data is presented in 1,000s live births. Here it was multiplied by 1,000 for this reason.

– Importantly data refer to 5 year intervals around the indicated year. E.g. 1952 refers to 1950-1954 in the original dataset. Here the value for the 5 year interval is divided by 5 and attributed to the mid-year of the interval.

sources.name: Child deaths – United Nations Population Division (2015)
sources.dataPublishedBy: United Nations, Department of Economic and Social Affairs, Population Division (2015). World Population Prospects: The 2015 Revision, custom data acquired via website.
sources.dataPublisherSource: Various, including censuses, vital registrations and maternity histories. Full source information can be found here: https://esa.un.org/unpd/wpp/DataSources/
sources.additionalInfo:
– The original data is presented in 1,000s live births. Here it was multiplied by 1,000 for this reason.

– Importantly data refer to 5 year intervals around the indicated year. E.g. 1952 refers to 1950-1954 in the original dataset. Here the value for the 5 year interval is divided by 5 and attributed to the mid-year of the interval.
